problem_text:
Let N ↣G ↠Q be an extension of nilpotent groups, with Q finitely generated, which splits at every prime. Does the extension split? This is known to be true if N is finite or commutative.
P. Hilton
answer: No, not always (K. Lorensen, Math. Proc. Cambridge Philos. Soc., 123, no. 2 (1998), 213–215).
